TopicTitle: Altering which direction the navball displays

Articles.Content:
There is a lander capsule from a mod that I think would be fun to use as a cockpit on spaceplanes. The problem is that in order to have the windows pointing in the correct direction to use on a plane/spaceplane I need to have the capsule in the same orientation as it would be on a rocket or lander. This means that when the plane is on the runway on its landing gear the navball centers on zenith ('up' direction) unlike a cockpit which would have the navball centered on horizontal. This doesn't just mean that the navball is all wrong (and so I can't see the direction I am actually travelling in on the navball), but the roll and yaw commands don't work right either. So, is there an easy way (by editing the cfg file or something) to alter this behaviour

The reason why I want to try this is that every cockpit I have tried has terrible visibility when trying to land on the runway in IVA mode, not much fun if you can't see where the runway is without heavily pitching down!

Edited January 27, 2015 by Rivelin
Title not quite right

It's not going to be easy. In fact the way you want to use it, I'd almost say it's not possible.

You can "trick" the navball by using a docking port or a probe oriented correctly and use the "control from here" option. Here is the catch, once you go IVA control reverts to the lander can. I don't know a way around that.

I have found the answer to this. Installing Raster Prop Monitor gives displays in the IVAs of many cockpits and pods. These displays have a menu called 'Target Management' and in this menu you can set 'Reference Part' to any capsule/cockpit/pod/core/mechjeb-module present on the craft and it'll set the navball (both on the rpm displays and the normal cockpit navball) orientation according to the orientation of the part you select. This means the part you are flying IVA in can be in any orientation you want as long as you have another command part in the orientation to give the navball behaviour that you require. Awesome!

Of course Raster Prop Monitor also solves my problem in another way by allowing the use of external cameras which can be placed to give visibility that the cockpit windows lack. This mod is brilliant!
